snippet: Ray Rice, who was arrested and charged with assaulting his then-fiancée on Feb. 15, said his actions "were totally inexcusable" in his first public comments since receiving a two-game suspension.
abstract: NFL Roundup; Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice breaks his silence after NFL's two-game suspension against him for Atlantic City altercation in which he assaulted his then-fiancee Janay Palmer, now his wife; says his actions were inexcusable and expresses deep regret; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: Ray Rice, who was arrested and charged with assaulting his then-fiancée on Feb. 15, said his actions "were totally inexcusable" in his first public comments since receiving a two-game suspension.

headline.main: Rice Breaks His Silence in a Public Repentance
headline.print_headline: Rice Breaks His Silence In a Public Repentance
